intro: Disciphania tessmannii, commonly known as the African sand thorn, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a shrub that typically grows in arid and semi-arid regions, often found in sandy or rocky soils. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Its leaves are usually small, fleshy, and adapted to reduce water loss. Disciphania tessmannii is known for its hardy nature and ability to thrive in harsh environmental conditions.
